text: Rosamunde Pilcher, OBE (née Scott; 22 September 1924 – 6 February 2019) was a British writer. She wrote many short stories and 28 romance novels and mainstream women's fiction from 1949 to 2000. Early in her career, she was also published under the pen name Jane Fraser. Her best-known work was The Shell Seekers. Pilcher was born in Lelant, Cornwall. Pilcher died from a stroke on 6 February 2019 at the age of 94. ==References== Category:1924 births Category:2019 deaths Category:English novelists Category:Writers from Cornwall
title: Rosamunde Pilcher
